title: PowerShell Development Best Practices
body: When developing PowerShell scripts: Use approved verbs (Get-Verb), implement proper error handling with try-catch blocks, validate parameters with [Parameter()] attributes, use Write-Host sparingly (prefer Write-Output), implement -WhatIf for destructive operations, and follow PowerShell naming conventions with PascalCase for functions and camelCase for variables.
